lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: They have tied me to a stake I cannot fly, But, bearlike, I must fight the course. Whats he That was not born of woman Such a one Am I to fear, or none.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Thoult be afraid to hear it.

lines.speaker: young siward
lines.text: No though thou callst thyself a hotter name Than any is in hell.

lines.speaker: young siward
lines.text: The devil himself could not pronounce a title More hateful to mine ear.

lines.speaker: young siward
lines.text: Thou liest, abhorred tyrant with my sword Ill prove the lie thou speakst.
They fight and YOUNG SIWARD is slain

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Thou wast born of woman But swords I smile at, weapons laugh to scorn, Brandishd by man thats of a woman born.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: That way the noise is. Tyrant, show thy face! If thou best slain and with no stroke of mine, My wife and childrens ghosts will haunt me still. I cannot strike at wretched kerns, whose arms Are hired to bear their staves: either thou, Macbeth, Or else my sword with an unbatterd edge I sheathe again undeeded. There thou shouldst be By this great clatter, one of greatest note Seems bruited. Let me find him, fortune! And more I beg not.

lines.speaker: siward
lines.text: This way, my lord the castles gently renderd: The tyrants people on both sides do fight The noble thanes do bravely in the war The day almost itself professes yours, And little is to do.

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: We have met with foes That strike beside us.
